articles.content:

articles.title: Ramaphosa cancels Davos trip amid South Africa energy crisis - The Guardian
articles.description: Africa’s most industrialised economy being hit by daily power cuts as anger grows among opposition and public
articles.content: Cyril Ramaphosa has cancelled his trip to the World Economic Forum in Switzerland as South Africa grapples with an unprecedented energy crisis that has resulted in daily power cuts of between eight a… [+4668 chars]

articles.title: Asake, Burna Boy and Davido: Nigerian artists win big at Afrima - BBC
articles.description: Burna Boy, Davido and Wizkid win at the All Africa Music Awards, while Asake says his prize is a dream come true.
articles.content:
Nigerian stars such as Burna Boy, Davido and Wizkid have dominated the winners' list at the eighth All Africa Music Awards (Afrima).
Tala, by Ivorian artist Didi B, was named song of the year at the… [+1718 chars]

articles.title: Stroke prevention, treatment, and recovery - Jacaranda FM
articles.description: Recently, strokes have gained attention after affecting, and in some cases killing, a number of South African celebrities. The following information on strokes will help you understand how to avoid them and how to recover if you suffered one.
articles.content:
Ten people suffer a stroke in South Africa every hour! This is according to the Heart and Stroke Foundation South Africa.

articles.title: SA set to welcome Russian warships despite criticism - News24
articles.description: South Africa will next month go ahead with naval exercises off its eastern coast with Russian and Chinese warships in a decision that could further strain its relationship with some of its biggest trading partners.

articles.description: The South African competitors in the 2023 Dakar Rally performed admirably, showcasing that our local talent can keep up with the world's best.
articles.content:
South Africans were the talk of the town during the 2023 Dakar Rally.
